description: Navigate a high-speed spacecraft through a dangerous cavern while managing tactical power-up systems.
rationale: This game focuses on horizontal scrolling mechanics and a unique upgrade system. It provides a strategic layer for AI agents to decide between immediate survival and long-term firepower upgrades, making it an excellent environment for reinforcement learning.
details: The game is a simplified side-scrolling shooter inspired by Gradius. The player controls a ship moving through a horizontally scrolling environment filled with obstacles and enemies. Key features include: 1. Continuous auto-scrolling to the right. 2. Enemies appearing in patterns from the right side of the screen. 3. A power-up bar at the bottom consisting of Speed Up, Missile, Double, Laser, and Shield. 4. Collecting red orbs advances the selection pointer on the power-up bar. 5. Tactical decision-making: the player must press a specific key to activate the currently highlighted power-up. 6. Collision with enemies or walls results in immediate life loss.
how_to_build:
uv init --app; uv add pygame; echo '[project]
name = "vector-gradius-side-scroller"
version = "0.1.0"
dependencies = ["pygame"]
' > pyproject.toml
how_to_play: Control the ship using Arrow Keys (Up, Down, Left, Right). Collect red orbs dropped by specific enemy waves to move the selection pointer on the bottom power-up bar. Press 'Space' to activate the selected power-up. Press 'Z' to fire the primary weapon. Scoring: Destroying a minor enemy adds 100 points, destroying a power-up carrier adds 200 points, and distance traveled adds 1 point per meter. The game ends when all lives are lost.

technical_specs.action_space: up, down, left, right, fire, activate_powerup
